# Title: Request for Proposal - Wipe Test Kits

## Description
The Department of National Defence seeks to procure the required Wipe Test Kits (WTK) for sampling potential areas contaminated with radioactivity on wet or dry surfaces.

## Tender Details
* Amendment: 1
* Solicitation Number: W8486-228441/D
* Publication Date: September 5, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: September 22, 2023, at 14:00 hours (GMT-04:00)
* Amendment Date: September 22, 2023
* Expected Contract Start Date: October 10, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2024
* Tender Status: Expired

## Procurement Method
This procurement is a competitive, open bidding process, with a preference for Canadian goods and/or services.

## Item Requirements
We require the following items:

* **Item 1**: 150 units of WTK (500 units per box) to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal (Quantity: 150 units, Unit of Issue: BX)
* **Item 2**: 50 units of WTK (500 units per box) to be delivered to 7 CFSD Supply Depot (Quantity: 50 units, Unit of Issue: BX)

## Technical Requirements
The submitted WTK solution should meet the following requirements:

* Be commercially available
* Consist of a pressure sensitive release paper, a chain of custody information block, and a water-based adhesive self-sticking cloth disc
* Chain of Custody information block should have dedicated space for the following: Unique identifier, date, time, location, notes, technician, and technician information
* Self-sticking cloth disc should be made of non-hazardous synthetic fibers with a diameter of 4.5 cm (1.75 inches) +/-10%

## NOX Contracting Entity Details
The contracting entity for this procurement is the Department of National Defence with an address located at 101 Colonel By Drive, Ottawa, ON K1A 0K2, Canada.

## Request for Proposal Response
In order to be considered, bidders must:

* Provide the Part Number and manufacturer information
* Fulfill all technical requirements
* Meet the commercial availability requirement

## Policy and Requirements
The Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
